ygData.subject: Re:  Screech to Escape
ygData.msgSnippet: ... druid. I ... I just wanted to mention.  If you get the time between your screeching and the druid gating.  Please do a zone shout when in places like Upper
ygData.messageBody:
>In a group - Screech is a devastatingly potent weapon in saving your parties
>collective butt. In lower guk while fighting dar's, zol's and a few wan's (the
>L36-46 range of undead froggies) we got trained by the hand room. The group
>leader called for an evac, but we were all being mobbed, including the
druid. I
>hit screech. No less then 6 L40+ frogs fled in terror, and I was L36. All
>conn'd
>blood red to me. The druid casted the evac successfully and we all escaped.

I just wanted to mention. If you get the time between your screeching and
the druid gating. Please do a zone shout when in places like Upper or
Lower Guk. Tell the zone that a train is leaving <rough location your at>.
Like "/shout Train leaving Hand room."

The reason I am requesting this is that once a frog in Guk starts moving
they usually start wandering as a huge mob. I have never seen a mob that
was running after someone go back to its spawn point when the person that
it was after zoned. They generally start wandering randomly as a group
hunting the next possible living thing to kill.

I am glad that you got out, but I'd hate to see another group get smacked
by 1 froggies running past from fear.


Lomack, Knight Defender of the BCK
Master of Recruiting
www.bck.org
"The Crimson Knights"
Fennin Ro
